message_1:
A small delivery company needs to deliver six packages to different locations. The company has two drivers available, and each driver can carry a maximum of three packages. The distance between each location and the company's starting point is given in the table below:

| Package   | Location A | Location B | Location C | Location D | Location E | Location F |
|-----------|------------|------------|------------|------------|------------|------------|
| Package 1 | 7          | 10         | 6          | 8          | 12         | 11         |
| Package 2 | 9          | 7          | 12         | 6          | 13         | 8          |
| Package 3 | 11         | 8          | 11         | 4          | 10         | 9          |
| Package 4 | 6          | 10         | 8          | 11         | 7          | 12         |
| Package 5 | 12         | 9          | 6          | 7          | 5          | 10         |
| Package 6 | 8          | 12         | 9          | 10         | 14         | 6          |

What is the minimum total distance that the two drivers need to travel in order to deliver all six packages? Provide the route for each driver.
